intro: Lastreopsis kermadecensis, commonly known as the Kermadec rockweed, is a species of green algae found in the coastal waters of the Kermadec Islands. It belongs to the family Ulvaceae and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth form. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, forming a thick, green mat that provides habitat for various marine organisms. Its structure consists of a central stalk with lateral branches, and it reproduces through both sexual and asexual means. This species plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems by contributing to primary productivity and stabilizing shorelines.
